Empire

Reagan Phelps

Bow down, bow downBow down, bow downBow down, bow downBow down, bow downBow down, bow downBow down, bow downBow down, bow downBow down, bow downBow down, bow down

Kneel at my feet

For this era is reborn

Without knowing the taste of defeat

Few still know, and few still care

Of my grand ruling dynasty

That met its lavish despair

No one is left in their dungeon of torturing

Full now of sickly smiling sycophants

And richly kingdomless royalty

My legacy has been stolen and my eyes have been maced

My feet have been cut, and my history erased


They knocked on my door

And they asked me for glory

They kicked me from my tower

And they burned every story


Yet now they have the audacity, the want, the need

To call for my rotting bones

And for forgiveness they plead

They don’t want the effort, they don’t want to rebuild

They just want to be at the top of the tower they killed


My crown has been shattered

And I’ve been stabbed with the shards

My blood stains the reflections

Of the gems where my name is carved


Bow down, bow down

To my kingdom no longer sought

Bow down, bow down

To the legend long forgot


My name, it is knowledge

And soon you will see

My empire has fallen

Now just an empty legacy

THE GREEN
